senses.de: to give freedom or allow to go
senses.ex: The police officer had to release the arrested man because there was not enough proof against him.

Tips.title: Legal Context
Tips.description: Often used in legal situations when someone is set free.
Tips.example: After the hearing, the suspect was released on bail.

Tips.title: Not Always Permanent
Tips.description: Release can be temporary, not necessarily a final action.
Tips.example: The journalist was released after questioning but remains under investigation.

Tips.title: Conditional Freedom
Tips.description: Release may come with conditions that limit one's actions.
Tips.example: He was released from jail on the condition that he would appear in court.

senses.de: to make something available to the public
senses.ex: The band is expected to release their new album next month.

Tips.title: Anticipation & Excitement
Tips.description: Often signifies excitement around a new product or artwork.
Tips.example: Fans lined up for the midnight release of the video game.

Tips.title: Marketing Buzz
Tips.description: Companies create buzz around a product by announcing its release.
Tips.example: The company teased the release of their new smartphone on social media.

Tips.title: Exclusive Release
Tips.description: Sometimes releases are limited or exclusive to generate more interest.
Tips.example: The designer announced an exclusive release of her new collection for VIP clients.

senses.de: the act of making something available to the public
senses.ex: The latest movie release attracted a huge audience.

Tips.title: Entertainment Industry
Tips.description: Commonly used to talk about movies, music, games availability.
Tips.example: The film's release was postponed due to unforeseen circumstances.

Tips.title: Release Date Importance
Tips.description: The release date can impact success, with holidays and weekends being prime.
Tips.example: The studio strategically scheduled the release for the Christmas season.

senses.de: to allow or cause something to escape
senses.ex: Heat is released into the atmosphere through the process of radiation.

Tips.title: Scientific Use
Tips.description: Commonly appears in scientific and environmental contexts.
Tips.example: The factory was fined for the illegal release of toxins into the river.

Tips.title: Health and Safety
Tips.description: Can indicate the danger when harmful substances are involved.
Tips.example: Emergency services responded to the release of chlorine gas from the plant.

Announce.wordDefinition:
Announce means to make known or to declare something to the public.

In simpler terms, announce is telling people about something new, while release is making that new thing available for people to use or buy.

Deliver.wordDefinition:
Deliver means to bring something to a person or place, while release means to set something free or let it go.

For example, you deliver a package to someone's doorstep, and you release a bird from a cage to let it fly away.

Deliver is often used in the context of transportation or sending something to a specific destination, such as delivering a pizza to someone's home.

To simplify it, deliver means to bring something to someone or somewhere, while release means to set something free or let it go.

Discharge.wordDefinition:
Discharge refers to the act of letting out something, such as a liquid, gas, or substance, from a container or a location, like a hospital or military service.

For example, a patient may be discharged from a hospital once they have recovered.

Discharge is more commonly used in medical or military contexts, while release is more commonly used in everyday situations.

Emit.wordDefinition:
emit and release are both verbs that relate to the act of letting something out or giving off.

Emit is generally used when talking about things that are given off from a particular source or object, such as light or sound.

For example, when a light bulb emits light, it means that it is producing or giving off light.

To summarize, emit describes the act of giving off from a particular source or object, whereas release is used when describing the act of setting something free or letting it go from a confinement.

Exempt.wordDefinition:
Exempt means to be excused or excluded from something. For example, if you are exempt from paying a certain fee, it means you do not have to pay that fee.

Exempt is applicable when you want to indicate that someone is excluded from something, while release is applicable when you want to indicate freedom or liberation.

Free.wordDefinition:
Free typically means that something is available without any cost or fee. For example, a person can get a free candy from a vending machine.

Free refers to something being available without cost, while release refers to making something available that was previously held or kept back.

Liberate.wordDefinition:
Liberate means to set someone or something free from imprisonment, slavery, or oppression.

It is typically used in situations where someone is being held against their will. For example, the soldiers worked hard to liberate the prisoners from the enemy's camp.

Liberate is used for freeing someone or something from captivity or oppression, while release is used in a broader sense of making something available or setting something free.

Publish.wordDefinition:
Publish generally refers to making something available to the public, such as a book, article, or website. It involves distributing or displaying the content for others to access.

While there may be some overlap between the two, the use of publish is typically more common in contexts related to written or electronic content, while release is often used in the context of physical products or media.

Unleash.wordDefinition:
Unleash means to set something free but with more power, energy or intensity. It implies a sudden or forceful release, like unleashing a dog from its leash, or unleashing a storm.

It can also be used to refer to emotions or actions, like unleashing your creativity or unleashing your potential.

Release is used for a gentler or controlled release, while unleash is used for a more forceful, powerful or intense release.

quotes.Text: I don't think I've ever not had a dark side. But one of the wonderful reasons why you go into this business is that half your life you live in a fantasy, which is somebody else's life. It's actually a great release because you're not having to deal with the itty-bitty bits of life.
quotes.Title: English Actress
quotes.Name: Felicity Kendal

quotes.Text: I actually think some of my best moments in life have been while I was with people from Instagram - whether it's super late nights getting a release out or being able to travel to places I'd never visited and meeting some of the most interesting people I've ever met.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Kevin Systrom

quotes.Text: You know, one of the disappointments about - for me, personally about being released - is that I left thousands of people behind. Now that 'For Life' is here, and here for everyone, it gives me the ability to touch millions at the same time.
quotes.Name: Isaac Wright Jr.

quotes.Text: Changes are not unusual - I mean, most movies, when they release them, they make changes. But somehow, when I make the slightest change, everybody thinks it's the end of the world.
quotes.Title: American Director
quotes.Name: George Lucas

quotes.Text: We wanna be on the frontlines of everything new and exciting. The old world order of putting out four singles before you release an album is so boring to us.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Zacky Vengeance

quotes.Text: I'm just going to write my books and do my work and release it. Let the world decide what it is, and if it's any good or not.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: James Frey

quotes.Text: You leave old habits behind by starting out with the thought, 'I release the need for this in my life'.
quotes.Title: American Psychologist
quotes.Name: Wayne Dyer

quotes.Text: You know how sad your life is when you know the release date of DVDs.
quotes.Title: English Chef
quotes.Name: Heston Blumenthal

quotes.Text: I think, it's important to understand how to release a film.
quotes.Title: Indian Actor
quotes.Name: Prosenjit Chatterjee

quotes.Text: The release date is just one day, but the record is forever.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Bruce Springsteen
